title: Jacques Touchard
text:
Jacques Touchard (1885–1968) was a <a href="French%20people">French</a> <a href="mathematician">mathematician</a>. In 1953, he proved that an odd <a href="perfect%20number">perfect number</a> must be of the form 12"k" + 1 or 36"k" + 9. In <a href="combinatorics">combinatorics</a> and <a href="probability%20theory">probability theory</a>, he introduced the <a href="Touchard%20polynomials">Touchard polynomials</a>. He is also known for his solution to the <a href="m%C3%A9nage%20problem">ménage problem</a> of counting seating arrangements in which men and women alternate and are not seated next to their spouses.
Touchard's Catalan identity.
